subject: Law
title: The Endangered Species Act
description: Learn The Endangered Species Act in one minute.

hook.text: The bald eagle was nearly extinct. The ESA protected it. Now there are over 300,000 in the lower 48 states.

buildup.text: The Endangered Species Act (1973) protects threatened and endangered species and their habitats.

discovery.text: Section 9 bans 'taking' (harming, harassing, or killing) listed species. Section 7 requires federal agency consultation.

twist.text: The ESA can block major projects. A tiny fishâ€”the snail darterâ€”once halted a $100 million dam in Tennessee.

climax.text: 99% of species ever listed under the ESA have avoided extinction. It's one of the most effective conservation laws.

punchline.text: Species on the brink got a legal lifeline. Most survived because of it.

quiz.question: What does Section 9 of the ESA prohibit?
